title: how to prevent disabling an addon
content:
hello firefox heroes,

I am looking for a way to prevent disabling an addon.

The addon is secondary, but for the sake of completeness: it's about the web blocker LeechBlock.

It was intended as an alternative to the web blocker ColdTurkey, but unlike ColdTurkey, which does not work for Linux systems, there is no password protection to prevent disabling and/or uninstalling the addon. Thus, it is quite easy to get distracted even though you don't really want to.

does anyone know a solution?

title: FF shuts down to update when I’m trying to use it.
content:
This often happens when I’m using it to play music. It’s also restarted when I’m trying to watch a video, read a web page or, once, when I was part way through setting up login details for a new bank account. I want to apply updates when it’s convenient for me, not when Firefox decides to update. So, how do I prevent my activities being interrupted by Firefox update?

I appreciate that it’s important to keep it up to date but I’m not happy when my activities are interrupted because Firefox decides that it needs to update itself. I suppose one approach would be to apply updates every day when I start Firefox however; I often have a specific task in mind when I start it so I really don’t want the distraction of having to update first.

Here’s what I’ve tried so far. None of these have stopped Firefox restarting itself:

On the Settings page: Select “Check for updates but let you choose to install them” Disable “Use a background service to install updates”

Since the above didn’t stop the Firefox restarts, I tried: Select “Automatically install updates (recommended)” with “When Firefox is not running”

In 'about:config' : Set 'app.update.auto', to FALSE. Set ‘app.update.background.interval’ to 31536000 (i.e. 1 year) Set ‘app.update.interval’ to 31536000 (i.e. 1 year) 

       Set 'app.update.auto.migrated' to FALSE.

In Windows Registry Editor, set: [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Mozilla\Firefox] "DisableAppUpdate"=dword:00000001

Used Win 10 to disable the “Mozilla Maintenance Service”: FF still restarts when I’m trying to use it. Also renamed the updater exe to: "C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox\updaterXXX.exe": auto update still runs (and installs a new updater.exe).
creator: firefox2351

title: Problem with netflix on firefox.
content:
Hello.

I have a serious problem with firefox, when I enter netflix and disney+, not only firefox but the whole system crashes automatically (it doesn't show bsod, the screen just freezes) and it only comes back with a hard reset. This can also happen on other websites but much more rarely, while on netflix and disney+ it is guaranteed to happen. The problem started after the upgrade to windows 11 from 10, it has never had such problems on windows 10.

With the edge I normally access netflix or disney+ and watch videos without ever having a problem.

firefox doesn't save a crash report, neither does windows, the mindump folder is empty.

my gpu is a r7 240 and cpu amd ryzen 5 3600.

title: how to restore multiple closed tabs; traditional recently closed windows and tabs or restore last session is not an option.
content:
I had multiple Firefox browsers and tabs open - simultaneously, and shut off Desktop PC. Whereas, traditional 'restore previous session' option opened most recently opened tab and site, and disregarded all other open tabs and browsers. Whereas, tabs and browsers I wish to open are still on Desktop, although Mozilla will not re-open them as they were (ie. will not re-assemble same order), instead Mozilla tried generating all tabs on one browser and then froze/crashed tyring to re-open all previously open tabs on one broser.

If you can, please assist with a step-by-step instructional - which instructs me on how to re-open all previous tabs which pre-date most recent preceding session (ie. disregard most recent preceding session) and re-open all other tabs which pre-dated most recent preceding session: as respective Desktop PC related-work was un-finished, and so that I might be able to continue at respective Desktop PC related-work.

Thank you. Adam
